Field Detail

DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE

public static final int DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE
Default size to create ALL incoming and outgoing buffers; this equates to the maximum size of message that can be sent or received.

NB: this variable is ONLY checked at construction time; you must alter it BEFORE constructing an instance of a server if you want it to have effect (or use the alternative constructor that allows you to specify a custom value for that instance only).

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SocketAcceptor

public SocketAcceptor(java.lang.String host,
                      int port)
Create a SocketAcceptor Acceptor, default selectTimeout is 0ms(selector will be blocked) and default sessionExaminePeriod is 1200000ms.

Parameters:
host - Socket will bind this address.
port - Socket will bind this port.

SocketAcceptor

public SocketAcceptor(java.lang.String host,
                      int port,
                      int selectTimeout)
Create a SocketAcceptor Acceptor with specific selectTimeout and sessionExaminePeriod

Parameters:
host - Socket will bind this address.
port - Socket will bind this port.
selectTimeout - If positive, block for up to timeout milliseconds, more or less, while waiting for a channel to become ready; if zero, block indefinitely; must not be negative

setReceiveBufferSize

public void setReceiveBufferSize(int receiveBufferSize)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Allocates a new byte buffer. The new buffer's position will be zero, its limit will be its capacity, and its mark will be undefined. It will have a backing array, and its array offset will be zero.

Parameters:
receiveBufferSize - capacity The new buffer's capacity, in bytes
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the capacity is a negative integer
Since:
1.0
